column4: I've been using Ubuntu since Warty Warthog, but I'm completely lost in 11.10. I tried add gnome-panel back, but I can't right click on anything to put quickstart icons on the menu bar. Also, all the options are gone to change the theme, e.g., move the close buttons back to the top right corner of the windows. Anyone know if there is a way to fix those things?
You probably want to go wiht GNOME Fallback mode as thats similar to gnome 2, which seems to be what you are looking for. Gnome 3 isnt that much different to Unity.

My only issue with Unity is the lack of customisation in its current form. It takes getting used to the new interface but in my opinion it works faster than a mouse based interface.. Still, its far to intrusive for me in its current form.
